sites.description: Official API reference for Unity scripting attributes and components.

sites.title: Unity Learn
sites.description: Self-paced tutorials and guided learning paths for Unity developers.

sites.title: Unity Scripting API
sites.description: Official API reference for Unity scripting attributes and components.

sites.title: Unity Learn
sites.description: Self-paced tutorials and guided learning paths for Unity developers.

rows.description: Serialize a private field so it appears in the Inspector.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector showing a private field visible because of [SerializeField].
rows.exampleNote: Use for private variables you want editable without exposing as public.

rows.description: Hide a public or serialized field from the Inspector.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector where a normally visible field is hidden via [HideInInspector].
rows.exampleNote: Good for keeping data serialized but uncluttered in the Inspector.

rows.description: Prevent a public field from being serialized by Unity.
rows.exampleAlt: Public field excluded from Unity’s serialization and not saved to scene/prefab.
rows.exampleNote: Still visible if public; value resets on domain reload and in builds.

rows.description: Remap serialized data from an old field name after renaming.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Remap serialized data from an old field name after renaming.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when remap serialized data from an old field name after renaming.

rows.description: Draw a bold header label above this field or group.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Draw a bold header label above this field or group.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when draw a bold header label above this field or group.

rows.description: Insert vertical space before the next field.
rows.exampleAlt: Extra vertical spacing inserted before the next field block.
rows.exampleNote: Use [Space(n)] to fine‑tune spacing; plain [Space] uses a default gap.

rows.description: Show hover-popup help text for the field label in the Inspector.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Show hover-popup help text for the field label in the Inspector.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when show hover-popup help text for the field label in the Inspector.

rows.descriptionHtml: Render a slider to clamp numeric values between min and max.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector slider created by [Range] on a float field
rows.exampleNote: Default slider styling in the built-in Inspector

rows.description: Clamp numeric values to a minimum.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Clamp numeric values to a minimum (no slider).
rows.exampleNote: Useful when clamp numeric values to a minimum.

rows.description: Clamp numeric values to a maximum.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Clamp numeric values to a maximum (no slider).
rows.exampleNote: Useful when clamp numeric values to a maximum.

rows.descriptionHtml: Render a multi-line text box between min and max lines.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Render a multi-line text box between min and max lines.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when render a multi-line text box between min and max lines.

rows.descriptionHtml: Attribute to make a string be edited with a multi-line textfield.
rows.exampleAlt: String field shows multiple lines in the Inspector without a scrollbar.
rows.exampleNote: Unlike TextArea, height is fixed; good for short paragraphs.

rows.description: Delay committing changes to string/numeric fields until focus is lost.
rows.exampleAlt: Value isn’t applied until focus leaves the field or Enter is pressed.
rows.exampleNote: Prevents spamming setters while typing—useful for expensive updates.

rows.description: Serialize polymorphic references (abstract/interfaces).
rows.exampleAlt: Field holds polymorphic types; Inspector lets you choose concrete implementations.
rows.exampleNote: Backed by managed reference serialization; avoid for value types/structs.

rows.description: Override the label shown in the Inspector.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Override the label shown in the Inspector.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when override the label shown in the Inspector.

rows.descriptionHtml: Add a small button next to the field that calls Method.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector field: Add a small button next to the field that calls Method.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when add a small button next to the field that calls Method.

rows.descriptionHtml: Prevent list reordering UI on a List.
rows.exampleAlt: List field renders without drag handles to prevent element reordering.
rows.exampleNote: Use when index order has semantic meaning tied to code.

rows.description: Place this component under a custom submenu.
rows.exampleAlt: Component header: Place this component under a custom submenu.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when place this component under a custom submenu.

rows.description: Prevent duplicates of this component on one GameObject.
rows.exampleAlt: Prevents adding more than one instance of this component per GameObject.
rows.exampleNote: Useful for managers or controllers that should be unique on an object.

rows.description: Auto-add or enforce component X on the same GameObject.
rows.exampleAlt: Component header: Auto-add or enforce component X on the same GameObject.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when auto-add or enforce component X on the same GameObject.

rows.exampleAlt: MonoBehaviour methods run in Edit Mode without pressing Play.
rows.exampleNote: Prefer ExecuteAlways for newer projects; be mindful of Editor‑only code.

rows.description: Execute in Editor even when disabled or in prefab mode.
rows.exampleAlt: Script executes in Edit Mode and when disabled or in prefab context.
rows.exampleNote: Guard runtime‑only logic with Application.isPlaying checks.

rows.description: Scene-view clicks on children select this GameObject
rows.exampleAlt: Clicking a child in the Scene view selects the parent GameObject instead.
rows.exampleNote: Handy for complex hierarchies like props with many sub‑meshes.

rows.description: Add a “?” icon linking to a url.
rows.exampleAlt: Component header: Add a “?” icon linking to a url.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when add a “?” icon linking to a url.

rows.description: Control script execution order.
rows.exampleAlt: Component header: Control script execution order.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when control script execution order.

rows.description: Exclude this assembly from player builds.
rows.exampleAlt: Marks an assembly as Editor‑only so it’s excluded from player builds.
rows.exampleNote: Place Editor scripts under an Editor assembly to reduce build size.

rows.description: API updater remaps types/namespaces after moving.
rows.exampleAlt: Signals that a type or namespace moved so API Updater can remap usages.
rows.exampleNote: Helps preserve serialized references after refactors or package splits.

rows.description: Add a right-click menu to invoke this method in the Inspector.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector/Editor method: Add a right-click menu to invoke this method in the Inspector.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when add a right-click menu to invoke this method in the Inspector.

rows.description: Add a top-bar menu item for this static method.
rows.exampleAlt: Inspector/Editor method: Add a top-bar menu item for this static method.
rows.exampleNote: Useful when add a top-bar menu item for this static method.

rows.description: Editor: run this static method when the Editor loads.
rows.exampleAlt: Static method runs when the Editor loads or scripts recompile.
rows.exampleNote: Avoid heavy work; initialize caches or register callbacks here.

rows.description: Run this static method before any scene loads in playmode/builds.
rows.exampleAlt: Static method runs before the first scene loads at runtime.
rows.exampleNote: Specify load types to run at different app phases (BeforeSceneLoad, etc.).

rows.description: Compile a job/function with Burst for high performance.
rows.exampleAlt: Method or job is compiled with Burst for major performance gains.
rows.exampleNote: Use with value types and unmanaged data for best results.

rows.description: Exclude a method from Burst compilation.
rows.exampleAlt: Excludes a method from Burst so managed or debug code can run.
rows.exampleNote: Wrap debug logging or conditional paths that Burst cannot compile.

rows.exampleAlt: Marks a NativeArray as write‑only to enable safety and performance checks.
rows.exampleNote: Prevents accidental reads; helps the job scheduler optimize.

rows.exampleAlt: Marks a NativeArray as read‑only so jobs can safely share data.
rows.exampleNote: Avoids race conditions and unlocks better parallel scheduling.

rows.description: Free a native collection when a job completes.
rows.exampleAlt: Automatically disposes a native container when its job finishes.
rows.exampleNote: Reduces manual cleanup but only for containers captured by the job.

rows.description: Allow unsafe parallel writes in jobs.
rows.exampleAlt: Allows parallel writes to the same data in a ParallelFor job.
rows.exampleNote: Use cautiously; you must ensure accesses are non‑overlapping.

rows.description: Skip safety checks on pointers in jobs.
rows.exampleAlt: Disables safety checks on pointers used inside jobs.
rows.exampleNote: Necessary for some interop; validate indices to avoid memory corruption.

rows.description: Prevent IL2CPP or managed stripping on this code.
rows.exampleAlt: Prevents code and members from being stripped by IL2CPP/linker.
rows.exampleNote: Apply to reflection‑accessed types or methods to keep them in builds.
